title: Worker Safety and Hygiene Supplies

requirements.question: Are first aid supplies readily available and accessible to harvest crew workers?
Are bandages and wound coverings waterproof and brightly colored for easy detection?
Are gloves available and used appropriately when required for worker protection or product safety?
Are hand sanitizers or disinfectants available in areas where handwashing facilities are not immediately accessible?
Is personal protective equipment (PPE) provided and maintained in good condition?
Are adequate supplies maintained for all hygiene stations throughout the workday?

mandatoryStatements: First aid supplies must be readily available and accessible to all harvest crew workers in case of injury.
All bandages and wound coverings used in product handling areas must be waterproof and brightly colored (e.g., blue) for easy visual detection if they become dislodged.
Gloves must be available for worker protection and product safety, and workers must be trained on when and how to use them properly.
Hand sanitizers or approved disinfectants must be available in field locations where handwashing facilities are not immediately accessible.
All personal protective equipment must be maintained in good, sanitary condition and replaced when damaged or worn.
capaInject: Establish an inventory management system for first aid supplies, bandages, gloves, and other hygiene materials with regular stock checks.
Implement a preventive replacement schedule for PPE and hygiene supplies before they become worn or depleted.
Create protocols for proper use and disposal of gloves to prevent cross-contamination between tasks or areas.
Designate responsibility for monitoring hygiene supply levels and restocking throughout the workday.
Develop training programs on proper PPE use, including when gloves are required and how to change them to prevent contamination.
traceabilityInject: Maintain inventory records of all hygiene supplies including purchase dates, quantities, and distribution to work areas.
Document first aid incidents including date, worker name, type of injury, treatment provided, and whether worker continued in product handling.
Keep records of PPE distribution to workers including glove sizes, types provided, and replacement frequency.
Log inspections of first aid kits and hygiene supply stations including date, inspector, and items restocked.
Track any product holds or investigations related to missing bandages or other foreign material concerns.
micro_inject: Ensure that use of hand sanitizers complements but does not replace proper handwashing with soap and water, especially after bathroom use.
Verify that gloves are used correctly and do not create a false sense of security that leads to reduced handwashing frequency.
Monitor that workers change gloves between different tasks or after contamination events to prevent cross-contamination.
Confirm that first aid supplies and bandages do not become sources of contamination themselves through improper storage or handling.
Ensure brightly colored bandages facilitate detection and removal if they contaminate product, reducing microbiological risk from wounds.
